text: How can I get the name of an object in Python?
Is there any way to get the name of an object in Python?

code:
my_list = [x, y, z] # x, y, z have been previously defined

for bla in my_list:
    print "handling object ", name(bla) # <--- what would go instead of `name`?
    # do something to bla

text: What I'm actually doing is creating a list of functions that I can specify by the command line.

code:
def fun1:
    pass
def fun2
    pass
def fun3:
    pass

fun_dict = {'fun1': fun1,
            'fun2': fun2,
            'fun3': fun3}

text: I get the name of the function from the commandline and I want to call the relevant function:
And the reason I want to have the name of the function is because I want to create fun_dict without writing the names of the functions twice, since that seems like a good way to create bugs.
What I want to do is:

code:
fun_list = [fun1, fun2, fun3] # and I'll add more as the need arises

fun_dict = {}
[fun_dict[name(t) = t for t in fun_list] # <-- this is where I need the name function

text: This way I only need to write the function names once.
